JobTitle: Territory Operations Manager, Uber Eats - South Coast
JobFullDesc: Whether it’s a sandwich, a burrito, or groceries, the Uber Eats team builds technology to connect people with what they want, when and where they want it. Our Strategy & Ops team empowers our regional and local teams through insights, analysis, and thought leadership.About the RoleThe Territory Operations Manager role is a unique opportunity to have a direct impact on the success of Uber Eats across the South Coast. The Territory Operations Manager will support the General Manager for their region by developing a deep, quantitative understanding of local market dynamics, building and cultivating relationships with key local partners and jumping on challenges as they emerge.This role calls for a combination of communication and stakeholder management skills, savvy analytics, critical thinking, strong execution and the interpersonal ability to work with teams from across the business. Further, as Uber Eats is a new business and remains a fast-paced environment, we are looking for a highly adaptable candidate who is able to switch between long-term pivotal initiatives one moment and pivot into rapid, tactical actions the next.What You'll DoLead the business performance throughout the South Coast markets, driving the top and bottom line results of our operations in the cities we serveBuild and nurture the relationship with restaurant partners (e.g. national chain's local franchisees; local influencers; local favourite independents)Win Local Favorites: identify key restaurant opportunities to lock in strategic partnerships, working with Restaurant sales to push these over the lineSecure Restaurant Selection: identify restaurant partnerships at risk through core metric analysis and build recommendations on how to prevent restaurant churnBuild Tools: identify gaps in restaurant selection or marketplace reliability to help ensure Central teams are maximising their impactExperiment: take the lead on local tests of new practices and document findings to help shape the future of our UK and EMEA processesWhat You'll NeedAt least 3 years of demonstrated experience within operations management / consulting / business development or strategy management in a large business, or growing start up environment.Experience in sales & account management with a strong background in business development and client management.Data-driven decision mentality and sound business judgment through very strong analytical thinking and modelling ability.Good business understanding and judgement. Comfortable in understanding a business through its financial information and thoughtful about overall strategic choices.Empathetic in dealing with different people. Able to quickly build relationships with external partners, couriers and internal team members.High adaptability to change and ability to execute quickly. Able to pivot quickly from long-term thinking to immediate action tactical response.Able to cope with pressure and an environment where not everything works yet. Willing to take ownership of problems rather than worry about whose problem it is.Curious and eager to learn about all aspects of the business. Can build up skills and knowledge very fast to become a recognized subject matter expert amongst your peers.Outstanding leadership skills with the ability to inspire, coach and manage a team.
